Articles.Content:
Hey guys I need a team for a upcoming project that have planned please email me at [email protected] if your interested (don't bother spamming that email it's all ready got a ton of spam)

Positions

High quality modellers

High quality animators

High quality texture makers

THE TEAM

TEAM LEADER

scottkiller2000

MODELLERS

Could be you here

ANIMATORS

Could be you here

TEXTURE MAKERS

could be you here

Edited May 20, 2013 by scottkiller2000
your better off joining a team that all ready have these in place.

When making recruitment pitches like this, it's always best to sell yourself. Tell the people you want to join just how useful you are. Tell them what your strengths are, what you bring to the table. Then tell them what you want to accomplish.

Otherwise, it just looks like all the other people who just say: "I'm the idea guy. The rest of you do the work."

Also, it doesn't inspire confidence when your team leader can't even type out full words like "please," or "you're."

Edited May 20, 2013 by JeBuSBrian

When making recruitment pitches like this, it's always best to sell yourself. Tell the people you want to join just how useful you are. Tell them what your strengths are, what you bring to the table. Then tell them what you want to accomplish.

Otherwise, it just looks like all the other people who just say: "I'm the idea guy. The rest of you do the work."

I think that's exactly what he is but needs someone to do the mod for him. I have my own team and yes I am mainly an idea guy but I have friends that do most of the work for me as well as teaching me how to do it my self.

SO unless he is a code writer he is just an idea guy.

Maybe you can, you know, learn how to do these things yourself? There are many helpful tutorials and people in the addon section. You do not need a team to make addons. Right now you come off as an "ideas guy" who wants other people to do the work while you sit around and do nothing.
Ok guys I do know how to make models in a thing called POV-ray

Ok guys I do know how to make models in a thing called POV-ray

Scott, I recall some time ago before the forum wipe we managed to get you to the point of installing blender and unity and then you sort of gave up, now you are back with a new thread

(what happened to Rizzo tech??) and you are using Povray you say?

Wrong direction mate, get blender again and unity and we will start again ok?

The kids making blender tutorials on youtube are younger than you, im sure you can get the hang of it if you really commit yourself. No one will join up if they can't see you making a decent contribution.

so you need a team for what? doing your work? letting you sit there doing nothing leading us when you dont have to offer any thing?

this is what comes in my mind when i see your post.

you wont get people to help if you do it this way.

hell your not even telling what you want to make.
